vocabularyDefinition.en: A chemical element or chemical compound (in pure form or in a mixture) as it occurs in its natural state or is the result of, used or released in a professional activity, whether intentionally or unintentionally produced.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A chemical element or chemical compound (in pure form or in a mixture) as it occurs in its natural state or is the result of, used or released in a professional activity, whether intentionally or unintentionally produced.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Observation to assess the chemical quality of water by the amount of a particular substance carried by the water.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Observation to assess the chemical quality of water by the amount of a particular substance carried by the water.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: The agent observed during the observation.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The agent observed during the observation.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The measured amount of cargo that was discharged from the chemical agent.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The measured amount of cargo that was discharged from the chemical agent.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Type of Observed Characteristic.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Type of Observed Characteristic.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Emission of something.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Emission of something.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: Typically production and disposal of a pollutant, e.g. a gas in the air or a liquid in water. Can also be sound or radiation, for example.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Typically production and disposal of a pollutant, e.g. a gas in the air or a liquid in water. Can also be sound or radiation, for example.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Relates the emission to the emission source from which it originates.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Relates the emission to the emission source from which it originates.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. the emission of wastewater emitted by the emission point (a pipe) in a duct.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The matrix (environment) in which the emission occurs.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The matrix (environment) in which the emission occurs.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: E.g. a chimney that emits emissions into the air, where the air is the matrix.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. a chimney that emits emissions into the air, where the air is the matrix.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Way in which the emission takes place.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Way in which the emission takes place.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. discharge, pumping, supply, etc.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Period in which the Emission occurred.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Period in which the Emission occurred.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The nature of the emission.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The nature of the emission.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Observation that assesses, according to a certain scale, the ecological status of water bodies based on their hydrological and morphological characteristics.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Observation that assesses, according to a certain scale, the ecological status of water bodies based on their hydrological and morphological characteristics.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: These include hydrological characteristics such as water depth, flow velocity, variations in water level and morphological characteristics such as the shape of the banks, soil substrate, presence of vegetation, etc.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: These include hydrological characteristics such as water depth, flow velocity, variations in water level and morphological characteristics such as the shape of the banks, soil substrate, presence of vegetation, etc.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Result of the Hydromorphological Observation.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Result of the Hydromorphological Observation.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Type of Observed Characteristic.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Type of Observed Characteristic.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Group of organisms typified by the fact that they can have fertile offspring together.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Group of organisms typified by the fact that they can have fertile offspring together.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: In this context, the type of plant, animal, microbe is used as a bioindicator.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In this context, the type of plant, animal, microbe is used as a bioindicator.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Place where Observations take place.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Place where Observations take place.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: Coherent set of places where Observations are carried out.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Coherent set of places where Observations are carried out.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: Spatial Sampling Object that is part of a Monitoring Network.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Spatial Sampling Object that is part of a Monitoring Network.

vocabularyDefinition.en: An observation of weather conditions at a certain place and time.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: An Observation of weather conditions at a certain place or time.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Origin of an emission.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Origin of an emission.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: It can be an establishment such as a factory, installation or chimney, but also an activity such as fertilization. Typically subject to environmental legislation and listed as a potential nuisance, see e.g. IIOAs of VLAREM.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Emission Source Identifier.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Emission Source Identifier.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The legislation applicable to the Emission Source.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The legislation applicable to the Emission Source.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. a company that discharges cooling water falls under heading 3.5 of APPENDIX 1 of VLAREM II.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The location of the emission source.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The location of the emission source.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: NOTE: Multiple locations are possible as long as they are of a different type (e.g. Address, Geometry...) and point to the same place.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE: Multiple locations are possible as long as they are of a different type (e.g. Address, Geometry...) and point to the same place.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The object in which the emission from the Emission Source ends up.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The object in which the emission from the Emission Source ends up.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Person or Organization responsible for the Emission Source.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: E.g. the person responsible for complying with the Permit applicable to the Emission Source.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. the person responsible for complying with the Permit applicable to the Emission Source.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Nature of the Emission Source.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: An observation according to a statistical methodology.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: An observation according to a statistical methodology.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE: A more detailed description can be found in the AP OSLO Statistics.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A collection of one or more water quality observations. The included observations share a value for one or more properties.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A location can be an identifiable geographic location (ISO 19112), but this location can also be a non-geographic location, such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as the

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of a geographical position,by means of coordinates,a toponym,an address label,a reference to a city/region or reference to an address.

A 0-dimensional geometric primitive in time.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Generic, weakly typed value.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Essentially a value and the name of the type of value. In this context, it is about things such as operator, ambient temperature, etc.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Name of the type of the value.
Qualitative or quantitative interpretation of the value.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Information about the operations that took place on the data or the source data that was used in producing the data.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE: More information about this data type can be found in ISO 19115 Geographic Information - Metadata.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A 1-dimensional geometric primitive in time.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Accuracy of the position of the data in a spatial reference system.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Abstract class for temporal objects.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Observations whose results are somehow related.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: It is about coherence that is important to understand the result of individual observations, e.g. biotic relationships (animal A is predator and is present because animal B occurs prey). Such relationships require to be explicitly described (as opposed to relationships such as the coincidence of results of Observations in space or time that may remain implicit). Also useful for relationships where the output of Observation A is the input for Observation B.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: The Provenance describes the origin and history of the Sampling Object. E.g. the method of sampling or the method followed in a field study.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The moment at which the result of the Observation was applicable.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The value of the observed Attribute as a result of the Observation.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Extent to which the result of the Observation meets the requirements or expectations.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: These are data that are specific to the Observation and complementary to the description of the procedure followed in the Observation (method of analysis, etc., see class Process), which in itself says something about the quality of the result.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Time at which the result of the Observation was obtained.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Nature of the coherence.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. Observation A "isInputFor" Observation B, Observation A "explains" the result of Observation B.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. the emission of wastewater emitted by the emission point (a pipe) in a duct.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The matrix (environment) in which the emission occurs.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The matrix (environment) in which the emission occurs.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: E.g. a chimney that emits emissions into the air, where the air is the matrix.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. a chimney that emits emissions into the air, where the air is the matrix.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Way in which the emission takes place.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Way in which the emission takes place.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. discharge, pumping, supply, etc.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Period in which the Emission occurred.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Period in which the Emission occurred.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The nature of the emission.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The nature of the emission.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Observation that assesses, according to a certain scale, the ecological status of water bodies based on their hydrological and morphological characteristics.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Observation that assesses, according to a certain scale, the ecological status of water bodies based on their hydrological and morphological characteristics.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: These include hydrological characteristics such as water depth, flow velocity, variations in water level and morphological characteristics such as the shape of the banks, soil substrate, presence of vegetation, etc.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: These include hydrological characteristics such as water depth, flow velocity, variations in water level and morphological characteristics such as the shape of the banks, soil substrate, presence of vegetation, etc.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Result of the Hydromorphological Observation.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Result of the Hydromorphological Observation.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Type of Observed Characteristic.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Type of Observed Characteristic.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Group of organisms typified by the fact that they can have fertile offspring together.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Group of organisms typified by the fact that they can have fertile offspring together.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: In this context, the type of plant, animal, microbe is used as a bioindicator.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In this context, the type of plant, animal, microbe is used as a bioindicator.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Place where Observations take place.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Place where Observations take place.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: Coherent set of places where Observations are carried out.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Coherent set of places where Observations are carried out.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: Spatial Sampling Object that is part of a Monitoring Network.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Spatial Sampling Object that is part of a Monitoring Network.

vocabularyDefinition.en: An observation of weather conditions at a certain place and time.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: An Observation of weather conditions at a certain place or time.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Origin of an emission.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Origin of an emission.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: It can be an establishment such as a factory, installation or chimney, but also an activity such as fertilization. Typically subject to environmental legislation and listed as a potential nuisance, see e.g. IIOAs of VLAREM.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Emission Source Identifier.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Emission Source Identifier.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The legislation applicable to the Emission Source.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The legislation applicable to the Emission Source.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. a company that discharges cooling water falls under heading 3.5 of APPENDIX 1 of VLAREM II.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The location of the emission source.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The location of the emission source.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: NOTE: Multiple locations are possible as long as they are of a different type (e.g. Address, Geometry...) and point to the same place.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE: Multiple locations are possible as long as they are of a different type (e.g. Address, Geometry...) and point to the same place.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The object in which the emission from the Emission Source ends up.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The object in which the emission from the Emission Source ends up.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: Person or Organization responsible for the Emission Source.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Person or Organization responsible for the Emission Source.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: E.g. the person responsible for complying with the Permit applicable to the Emission Source.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. the person responsible for complying with the Permit applicable to the Emission Source.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Nature of the Emission Source.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Nature of the Emission Source.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

vocabularyDefinition.en: An observation according to a statistical methodology.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: An observation according to a statistical methodology.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE: A more detailed description can be found in the AP OSLO Statistics.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A collection of one or more water quality observations. The included observations share a value for one or more properties.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A Collection of one or more WaterQualityObservations,whose members share a common value for one or more properties.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A reference to the object that was observed during the observations in the collection.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A reference to the object that was observed during the observations in the collection.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A reference to the object that was observed during the observations in the collection.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A reference to the Object that is observed bij the Observations in the Collection.

vocabularyDefinition.en: The moment when the result of the observation in the collection could be applied.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The moment when the result of the Observation in the Collection was applicable.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A description of the weather conditions during the Observations in the Collection.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: A description of the weather conditions during the Observations in the Collection.
